issues.summary: Purchase Request – When a Purchase Request is auto-approved, the system does not display any details in the Approval Status pop-up
issues.description: Issue:  Purchase Request – When a Purchase Request is auto-approved, the system does not display any details in the Approval Status pop-up Server: URL:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com/#/login Username:  zulkiful.bajwa+employeeStage85NBCU@vroozi.com Password: @Welcome1  Pre-Conditions: The feature toggle  INTEGRATION__EXTERNAL_TIMELINE  should be  disabled  for the relevant Unit ID The following flags should be set to  true  in the  company_settings  collection: externalWorkflowEnabled: true externalServiceConfiguration.timeline: true  (This setting was introduced in  RC-2025-5 . So, if you are testing this ticket before  RC-2025-5  code, please exclude this setting.) A Purchase Request should be created in  Draft  status, and no approval should be required for it Steps to Reproduce: Log in to PMAN as an Employee user Load the above-created Purchase Request Click on the Approval Status button Verify the Approval History in the Approval Status pop-up Actual Result: The system does not display any details in the Approval Status pop-up Screen Shot on Stage: ScreenShot on Production: Expected Result: The system should display the correct Approval History or an appropriate message in the Approval Status pop-up

issues.summary: Stage - MEMO/PRQ - Approval Chain is not showing for the Memo/PRQ having Approval Rule Matched.
issues.description: URL:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com/ username:   asma.latif+EMP2504@vroozi.com password:  Blueangel1@ Preconditions: PRQ User should have logged into the Application. Dynamic WF should be enabled and Rule should exist for PRQ document. Steps to Reproduce: Create a PRQ with its item having Accounting elements matched with the Active Approval Rule.  7500002532 Click the Approval Chain Icon from right side panel. Please see it says “No Approval Chain Available”. Logout and Login as AP User. Click to Create a Memo with its item having Accounting elements matched with the Active Approval Rule.  9500004516 Click the Approval Chain Icon from right side panel. Please see it says “No Approval Chain Available”. Actual result: It says “No Approval Chain Available” when PRQ has an approval rule matched. Expected result: Approval Chain should show. Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: Stage - PMAN/SDM - Reports - Excel File Download is not working for Report Types except Users Report.
issues.description: URL:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com/ username:   asma.latif+RC4_SDM_Admin1@vroozi.com  /  asma.latif+RC4_SDM_PU1@vroozi.com  /  asma.latif+RC4_SDM_BU1@vroozi.com password:  Blueangel1@ Preconditions: SDM Admin/Power/Basic User with Default Location set as 'ALL' should have logged into the Application. Steps to Reproduce: Access Reports > Select any Type and Click Excel File. Click Download Excel. Please see blank tab opens in the browser and no file is being downloaded. Actual result: Clicking Download Excel File opens a blank Browser Tab with the following URL hence the file isn’t downloaded. https://stage-purchase.vroozi.com/api/sdm-reports/report/download/QUICK_CONTACT_EXCEL_REPORT/Quick-Contacts-Report-03-14-2025-122907648UTC   Expected result: Excel file should be downloaded and viewed successfully. Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: PROD - Enhanced WF - Approval Rule Modal - SDM Users are available in the Approver Drop Down.
issues.description: Environment: https://stage-go.vroozi.com Username :  notifyvroozi@gmail.com Password:  Welcome1@/@Welcome1 Pre-Requisites: Feature Toggle ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_ENHANCED_WORKFLOW should be enabled for the Unitid in DB. Admin User should have logged into the Application. Steps to Reproduce: Access Company>Workflow. Click to Add an Approval Rule in the  Approval Rules  Subsection of  Financial and Invoice Approval Workflow   Section. Approval Rule Modal opens. Select Applies to = PR, CR, Invoices, Memo, PRQ. Add Conditions. Click + to Add Approval Chain. Search for “Asma”. Please see Users holding Fin and AP Approver roles start appearing and also SDM role users too which aren’t either financial/Ap Approvers. Actual Result: Users holding Fin and AP Approver roles start appearing and also SDM role users too which aren’t either financial/Ap Approvers. →   FYI: The system is matching any user that has a production with the name containing the text you used for a search (disregarding the role) Expected Result: Only Financial, AP approvers or Users holding both roles should appear in the Approver drop down. Screen-Cast: Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: DEVQA5 - Integration - Voided Invoice has the Assignee against it.
issues.description: URL:  https://devqa5-purchase.vroozi.com username: asma.latif+AP2@vroozi.com password:  Blueangel1@ Preconditions: AP User should have logged into the Application. "ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__INVOICE_DISPUTE" should be Enabled in the DB for the Company Unit Id. Allow Invoice Dispute should be ON for the logged in Supplier. Voided Invoice Exists. Steps to Reproduce: Access Voided Invoice via Voided Page. Please see the Assignee label on the top right side. Assignee shows the SP User who Voided the Invoice. Access ALL Page under Track Invoices. Remove Assigned to me filter. Please see this Invoice has the Assignee shows the SP User logo. Actual result: Voided Invoice has the Assignee against it. Expected result: Voided Invoice should not have any Assignee and behave just like the Posted Invoice which also does not have any Assignee. Screen-shot:  Thanks, Asma

issues.description: Issue: Purchase Order - When a user performs any action directly on the Purchase Order or indirectly through a related transactional document of a particular Purchase Order that causes a change, the system does not update the Externally Synced flag on the PO Server: URL:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com/#/login Username:  zulkiful.bajwa+StageEmployeeUnitId77@vroozi.com Password: @Welcome1 Pre-Condition: A Purchase Order, such as ‘2000009941’, has been successfully created, and its  externallySynced  flag is set to  true Steps to Reproduce: Log in to PMAN as an Employee user Load the Purchase Order ‘2000009942’ and create a partial or full Goods/Service Receipt Fetch the Purchase Order using the GET API and verify the  externallySynced  flag value Actual Result: The system retains the  externallySynced  flag as  true Expected Result: The system should update the  externallySynced  flag to  false Note: This issue needs to be fixed for scenarios where a user performs any action on the Purchase Order directly or indirectly, such as  Invoiced, Confirmed, Disputed, Partially Confirmed, Partially Disputed, Shipped, etc.

epic.description: Thomas Supply & Distribution - Netsuite Integration Phase 2 PROD & SOCI unitIds: 276 Admin user email:  admin.tos2@vroozi.com The Scope of work includes the following items. Bring new master data from Netsuite Read re-order quantities from Netsuite create Purchase Request / or Purchase Order in Vroozi for the re-order items. Create the Purchase order in Netsuite. Create Item Receipt in Netsuite. Post Invoices to Netsuite. Post Credit memo to Netsuite. Bring Payment information from Netsuite In review by Project team. Bring Inventory items into Netsuite and create catalogs

issues.summary: Unable to update externalID via Submit Purchase Order endpoint
issues.description: Client: Thomas Supply Issue statement: The Netsuite Integration with Thomas Supply requires the middleware to store the Netsuite Internal ID of the Purchase Order to reference it on the Invoice document when posting to Netsuite. The middleware is doing so using the  /purchase-orders/submit  endpoint to submit an existing Purchase Order along with the external Id. It appears that the  /purchase-orders/submit  endpoint is not storing the external ID when posting the Purchase Order information with the external ID instead it is trying to create a new Purchase Order. Steps to reproduce: Fetch an existing Purchase Order using the  /purchase-orders/{id} endpoint and utilize the response and submit a Request to  /purchase-orders/submit  including the data in the externalId field. Current Result:  The API is creating another Purchase Order. Expected Result: The API should update the existing Purchase Order and populate the externalId field.

issues.summary: QA: Properties Comparison Test script
issues.description: The goal of this ticket is to compare the properties loaded with and without config server help. This actuator can be used to get the properties here at this link  http://localhost:8080/actuator/env .  The goal of this ticket is to create a script that compares the pre loaded properties in spring context with the ones that are loaded with the help of config server. Steps are as follows Get the pre and post implementation properties json files using actuator. Create a python script that load these properties and compare the values between them Identify if any value is changed from pre state to post state or if any key is missing. Create a new file that contains the results. If the file is empty this means there is no change. The no changes explains that all properties are loaded correctly.

epic.description: Develop the Invoice Dispute Process to enable clients to manage invoice discrepancies effectively with the Supplier.

issues.summary: Supplier Portal: Display and Filter Disputed and Voided Invoices in the Invoices page
issues.description: Business Case: Enable Supplier Portal users to view and filter invoices with "Disputed" and "Voided" statuses on the Invoices page. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? As a  Supplier Portal user , I want to be able to see invoices that are in  Disputed  and  Voided  status on the Invoices page, So that I can track and manage invoices that require my attention. Which customers should this change impact? Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact? Supplier Portal > Invoices page Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. How should this feature work? The  Invoices page  in the Supplier Portal should display invoices with the following statuses: Disputed Voided The  Status Filter  on the Invoices page should include the following options: Disputed Voided All other existing invoice statuses When a Supplier Portal user selects  Disputed  from the Status Filter, only invoices marked as  Disputed  should be displayed. When a Supplier Portal user selects  Voided  from the Status Filter, only invoices marked as  Voided  should be displayed. If no status filter is applied, all invoices (including  Disputed  and  Voided  invoices) should be displayed by default. When the Supplier Portal user  clicks on the three-dot menu (More Actions)  for an invoice in  Disputed  or  Voided  status: The only available action should be  "View Invoice." Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: PMAN: Users should not see the Invoice Dispute Process until the feature is at least completed for Supplier Portal.
issues.description: Business Case : As a  user  interacting with the Supplier Portal, I  do not  want to see the Invoice Dispute Process enhancements until they have been fully developed and are ready for release. This ensures that I am not exposed to incomplete or non-functional features and reduces potential confusion or frustration. Acceptance Criteria : Initial State (Feature Hidden): Users should not see any Invoice Dispute Process-related UI elements or functionalities. Feature Toggle Implementation: Introduce a temporary feature toggle (e.g.,  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__INVOICE_DISPUTE ) to control the visibility of the Invoice Dispute Process features. When the toggle is  off , the Invoice Dispute Process features remain hidden. When the toggle is  on , all developed Invoice Dispute Process features become visible and usable by all users. Toggle Removal Post-Completion: Once the Invoice Dispute Process feature is completely developed for Supplier Portal clients, remove the temporary feature toggle and ensure the feature is permanently visible to the users. Testing & Verification: Verify that toggling the switch on/off reliably hides and shows the Invoice Dispute Process features. Ensure no partial or placeholder elements are visible when the toggle is off.

issues.summary: PMAN: Introduce 'Voided' status page to Track Invoices.
issues.description: Business Case: Allow AP users to view invoices voided by the supplier on the new 'Voided' page under Track Invoices section in the navigation panel. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Add a new tracking page for ‘Voided' Invoices under the 'Track Invoices' section in the navigation panel. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true. What pages should this change impact?  Navigation Panel > Track Invoices. Which users should be impacted by the change? AP Processor. AP Manager, Admin. How should this feature work? Navigation Panel Display: A new option labeled  'Voided'  is added under the  'Track Invoices'  section in the navigation panel. Count Display: No count is displayed next to the  'Voided'  option, even if voided invoices are assigned to an individual AP user, as no further action can be taken on these invoices. The  'Voided'  page is accessible to all users with appropriate permissions, regardless of the presence of disputed invoices. Page Behavior: Clicking the  'Voided'  option opens the  Voided  page, displaying the relevant invoices based on the user's role: AP Processor:  The page displays non-deleted invoices in  'Voided'  status: Invoices that were submitted for dispute by the logged-in user and subsequently voided by the supplier. Or where the logged-in user is the owner of the invoice. AP Manager & Admin Users:  The page displays all non-deleted invoices in  'Voided'  status linked to the  unitId  of the logged-in user. Default Columns Displayed:  The following columns are displayed by default when users navigate to the  Voided  invoice page: Invoice #:  Displays the system-generated invoice number. PO #:  Displays the Purchase Order number linked to the invoice (if available). Supplier Invoice #:  Displays the invoice number provided by the supplier. Supplier:  Displays the name of the supplier associated with the invoice. Total:  Displays the total amount of the invoice. Voided Date:  Displays the date the invoice was voided. Column Preferences: Users can configure which columns to display on the  Voided  invoice page. Along with the default columns listed above, users can choose to display the following additional columns: Invoice Date : Displays the date the invoice was issued. Created Date : Displays the date the invoice was created in the system. Updated Date:  Displays the date the invoice was last updated. Payment Due Date:  Date payment is due based on payment terms. Company Code : Displays the company code associated with the invoice. Total Shipping : Displays the total shipping charges on the invoice. Total Tax : Displays the total tax amount on the invoice. Requester | Buyer : Displays the Requester | Buyer on the Invoice. Voided   Status specific filtering in the search bar : Track All Invoices page. Pagination: Pagination is displayed on the bottom-right corner of the  Voided  invoice page. Ten (10) invoices are displayed per page. Users can navigate between pages using the pagination controls. Invoice Counts: The total count of invoices in  'Voided'  status is displayed on the bottom-left corner of the page. The range of invoices displayed on the current page (e.g., "1-10 of 50") is also shown. Search Bar: A search bar is available at the top of the page where users can input search criteria. The search bar supports filtering by fields such as  Assignee, Created By, Supplier, Invoice Total,  and more. Column Sorting: All columns, are sortable in both ascending and descending order. Users can click column headers to apply sorting. Default Sorting: The  Voided  invoice page is sorted in descending order by the  Invoice #  field by default. Ellipsis Menu: Should function in a similar manner to other status pages . Note to QA: In addition to testing the AC, please also perform the following: Test negative test cases when the ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW toggles is 'off'. Verify that deleted invoices are not displayed in the disputed status page. Verify for users with multiple combination of roles: AP Processor + AP Approver, etc. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date           # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

Timestamp of voiding (e.g., "SP user initials → Invoice #9000000505 has been voided at 12:49 PM on 11/11/2024") Do we need a data fix for existing customers? Add dashboard tiles for Disputed and Voided invoices in the Supplier Portal with direct links to filtered lists. Which customers should this change impact? issues.summary: PMAN: Introduce 'Disputed' status page to Track Invoices.
issues.description: Business Case: Allow AP users to view invoices submitted for dispute on the new 'Disputed' page under Track Invoices section in the navigation panel.  Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Add a new tracking page for ‘Disputed' Invoices under the 'Track Invoices' section in the navigation panel. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true. What pages should this change impact?  Navigation Panel > Track Invoices. Which users should be impacted by the change? AP Processor. AP Manager, Admin. AP Auditor  (Need to confirm) How should this feature work? Navigation Panel Display: A new option labeled  'Disputed'  is added under the  'Track Invoices'  section in the navigation panel. Count Display: No count is displayed next to the  'Disputed'  option, as disputed invoices cannot be assigned to individual AP users. The  'Disputed'  page is accessible to all users with appropriate permissions, regardless of the presence of disputed invoices. Page Behavior: Clicking the  'Disputed'  option opens the  Disputed  page, displaying the relevant invoices based on the user's role: AP Processor:  The page displays non-deleted invoices in  'Disputed'  status: Submitted for dispute by the logged-in user. Or where the logged-in user is the owner of the invoice. AP Manager & Admin Users:  The page displays all non-deleted invoices in  'Disputed'  status linked to the  unitId  of the logged-in user. Default Columns Displayed:  The following columns are displayed by default when users navigate to the  Disputed  invoice page: Invoice #:  Displays the system-generated invoice number. PO #:  Displays the Purchase Order number linked to the invoice (if available). Supplier Invoice #:  Displays the invoice number provided by the supplier. Supplier:  Displays the name of the supplier associated with the invoice. Payment Due Date : Displays the payment due date associated with this invoice. Reason:  Displays the reason for disputing the invoice.   (We can live without this due to it being a multi-select field) Total:  Displays the total amount of the invoice. Disputed Date:  Displays the date when the invoice was submitted for dispute. Assignee:  Displays the individual or entity associated with the dispute. Column Preferences: Users can configure which columns to display on the  Disputed  invoice page. Along with the default columns listed above, users can choose to display the following additional columns: Invoice Date : Displays the date the invoice was issued. Created Date : Displays the date the invoice was created in the system. Updated Date : Displays the date the invoice was last updated. Company Code : Displays the company code associated with the invoice. Total Shipping : Displays the total shipping charges on the invoice. Total Tax : Displays the total tax amount on the invoice. Requester | Buyer : Displays the Requester | Buyer on the Invoice. Dispute Status specific filtering in the search bar : Track All Invoices page. Overdue Invoices page. Pagination: Pagination is displayed on the bottom-right corner of the  Disputed  invoice page. Ten (10) invoices are displayed per page. Users can navigate between pages using the pagination controls. Invoice Counts: The total count of invoices in  'Disputed'  status is displayed on the bottom-left corner of the page. The range of invoices displayed on the current page (e.g., "1-10 of 50") is also shown. Search Bar: A search bar is available at the top of the page where users can input search criteria. The search bar supports filtering by fields such as  Assignee, Created By, Supplier, Disputed Date, Reason, Invoice Total,  and more. Column Sorting: All columns, except  Assignee,  are sortable in both ascending and descending order. Users can click column headers to apply sorting. Default Sorting: The  Disputed  invoice page is sorted in descending order by the  Payment Due Date  field by default. Ellipsis Menu: Should function in a similar manner to other status pages . Note to QA: In addition to testing the AC, please also perform the following: Test negative test cases when the ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW toggles is 'off'. Verify that deleted invoices are not displayed in the disputed status page. Verify for users with multiple combination of roles: AP Processor + AP Approver, etc. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. issues.summary: Supplier Portal / Payables: Introducing Voided Status for Invoices
issues.description: Business Case: Allow SP users to void invoices when appropriate, marking them as unusable but visible for tracking. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Add a Voided status for disputed invoices, allowing SP users to cancel invoices with proper tracking and notifications. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Disputed Invoices. Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. How should this feature work? Key Features : New " Void " button for disputed invoices on the SP side.  Visible only for disputed invoices. Button Color:   Gray  ( Open to the Team’s color suggestions ) If the SP user clicks on the  Void  button: The  Invoice Destination Box  opens with the following: Next Action Text . Void Sub-text . This cancels the invoice and stops further processing. Warning Message .   (To avoid any accidental disputes) Warning: Please confirm this action carefully. Once voided, the invoice cannot be edited or processed further. Comments  (free-text field for additional details). Required  for Void action. Voiding the disputed invoice : The invoice status updates to: Voided  on the SP side. ( Team to suggest color schemes for the Voided status ) Voided  on the AP side. ( Team to suggest color schemes for the Voided status ) Invoice becomes un-editable and non-processable. AP user or SP user can no longer take action on this invoice. Sends a notification (NOTY message) to AP user(s). AP user & SP user should also be able to see Invoices in Voided status. Voided invoices are treated as if they are deleted but remain visible to both SP and AP users. ( Don’t take this in literal sense, this is just for understanding purposes .) The user assignment after the invoice has moved over to Voided status should work in a similar manner to Posted invoices where there is no user assigned to the Invoice. PO Handling : PO details remain linked to the voided invoice for tracking. Line items/quantities become reusable for a different Invoice. Mock Screenshot : Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks    Using a warning message in the Invoice destination as part of the confirmation message when voiding.

issues.summary: Payables: Allow AP users to Dispute Invoice to Supplier Portal.
issues.description: Business Case: Allow AP users to submit invoices for dispute purposes when the supplier has the "Allow Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal" toggle ON. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Allow AP users to dispute invoices in eligible statuses and submit them to the Supplier Portal with specific reasons and recipients. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Invoices in these statuses - Draft. Parked. Rejected. Which users should be impacted by the change? Document creator/owner (AP Processor). Any AP Manager How should this feature work? Key Features : AP users  can  dispute invoices if the ' Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal ' toggle is set to  ON  for the supplier linked to the respective invoice. AP users  cannot  dispute invoices if the ' Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal ' toggle is set to  OFF  for the supplier linked to the respective invoice. AP users can dispute invoices in  Draft ,  Parked , or  Rejected  statuses. AP users are allowed to dispute invoices created via  Supplier Portal ,  Email (OCR) ,  CXML ,  API   (need some info about this method) . AP users are allowed to dispute invoices created  Manually   (Will confirm with internal stakeholders regarding disputes for manual invoices) . In the Invoice destination section, the dispute submission includes: Warning Message .   (To avoid any accidental disputes) Warning: Please confirm that all details are correct before submitting. This action cannot be undone. Reason .  ( The team will review and confirm whether we can implement the multi-select reason option, similar to company code restriction or PO line item dispute. ) Configurable via backend to remove options. Dropdown options - Billing Error Price Discrepancy Quantity Mismatch Incorrect Tax Calculation Invalid or Missing Purchase Order Number Duplicate Invoice Unauthorized Charges Missing or Incorrect Invoice Details Delivery Issues Incorrect Document Type Incorrect Billing Address or Subsidiary Dispute Via . Supplier Portal. If the invoice can only be disputed via the Supplier Portal, it should be  pre-selected  and cannot be changed by the AP user. Email. ( Future - not part of this ticket, but for reference ) If the invoice can only be disputed via email, it should be pre-selected and cannot be changed by the AP user. Recipient : For Supplier Portal (SP) Invoices: If an SP invoice is disputed, the dispute is assigned to the SP user who created and sent the invoice, as long as they are still active. Example :   Adam creates SP Invoice 90000056789. If disputed, the dispute goes to Adam if he's still active. If the original SP user is inactive, the AP user can select another SP user from a list of all SP users linked to the supplier. (   to check what the current system behavior is on who can see the invoice and accordingly decide Administrator or Order Processor should be allowed to take the action. ) Example :   If Adam is inactive, the AP user can assign the dispute to another SP user, like Ryan. If no SP users are active for the supplier, the invoice cannot be disputed via the Supplier Portal. For Non-SP Invoices (Email, OCR, cXML, API) and Manually Created Invoices  (Will confirm with internal stakeholders regarding disputes for manual invoices) : If disputed, the AP user can assign the dispute to an SP user from a list of SP users linked to the supplier. Example :   Matthew sends Invoice 90000056452 via email. If disputed, the AP user can assign it to Adam, Matthew, or Ryan. If no SP users are active for the supplier, the invoice cannot be disputed. Future Consideration: Support for notifying multiple or all SP users linked to the supplier for disputes may be added later.  (Not needed right now) Smart assignment for Non-SP invoices in the future where we could try to link email address or supplier name, etc. from the Email / cXML / API to see if there is a matching SP user with that same credentials in the system.  (Not needed right now) Comments  (free-text field for additional details). Submitting the dispute : Changes the invoice status on the AP side to  Disputed  status. Invoice status on the SP side would change to  Disputed  status as well. Sends an email notification to the SP user letting them know that the invoice has been disputed  (Separate ticket for the SP User email template) . Sends a notification (NOTY message) to eligible SP users. AP Processor / AP Manager should not be allowed to edit this disputed invoice until the dispute has been resolved. Audit Log Tracking : Track all dispute actions in the AP system’s Audit Logs to allow a historical view of disputes and resolutions. Lets re-use the texts that we used for our demo in the audit history section -    Mock Workflow :   Mock Screenshot : Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date  What are the common reasons that should always be used for all customers and how reporting can be affected by adding or removing a reason from the backend?        12/03/2024       Should we allow AP users to add attachments to explain the dispute in more detail, which can be shared via the Supplier Portal or Email?   12/05/2024  /    Should AP users be allowed to dispute invoices that they manually created?   12/05/2024  /    Should comments be required for the AP user when submitting the dispute.   12/05/2024  /    # Question Recommendation Response Remarks    Should we use multi-select option like dispute on PO line item for the Reason section? Team needs to check how this can be efficiently implemented.

epic.summary: SDM: NBCU Supplier Discovery Module Enhancement (Phase 3)
epic.description: Phase 3 of Supplier Discovery Management (SDM) Enhancements focuses on improving configurability, access control, and user experience through various quality-of-life (QoL) improvements and fixes. Key updates include configurable guidelines by user group, enhanced SDM Location toggle behavior, hiding the Supplier Exception Form link when EF access is disabled, and updating tooltips for clarity. Additional optimizations will further refine SDM functionality and usability. Business Objectives: Enhance Configurability  – Provide organizations with greater control over SDM settings by allowing user group-based configurations. Improve User Experience  – Reduce confusion by ensuring that UI elements, tooltips, and messages are contextually accurate. Strengthen Access Control  – Ensure users only see and interact with features they are authorized to use. Optimize System Usability  – Implement QoL improvements that streamline workflows and reduce inefficiencies in supplier discovery and management.

issues.summary: PMAN / SDM: Improve Role Labels Displayed to PMAN Admins in User Grid Based on User Group Selection
issues.description: Business Case: Currently,  PMAN Admins  see all users in the  SDM > Master Data > Users  and  PMAN > Master Data > Users  grids with a role label based on the  Default User Group setting  rather than the user’s actual assigned user group. This causes confusion, as the displayed role does not accurately reflect the user’s group-based designation. To enhance clarity, the system should update the  Role  column in the  Users Grid  to reflect the  correct role label  based on the  user's assigned user group  instead of the default group setting. Note :    We had briefly discussed this back during the Phase 2 implementation. I believe this can be done more efficiently with fewer API calls, but we didn’t pursue it at the time due to the tight deadline for completing the MVP project. Here is comment for reference -   and     Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? As a  PMAN Admin , I want to see the  correct role labels  in the  User Grid  of  SDM > Master Data > Users  and  PMAN > Master Data > Users , So that I can accurately identify users based on their  actual assigned user group  rather than a default setting. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers using the SDM module (ex: NBCU). What pages should this change impact? PMAN > Master Data > Users. SDM > Master Data > Users. Which users should be impacted by the change? PMAN Admin. How should this feature work? Role Label Updates Based on User Group: The  Role  column in the  Users Grid  should reflect the  correct user group label  configured for each user, rather than using the  Default User Group  setting. Example -  If a user belongs to the  Redbook  user group, their role should be displayed as: Redbook Admin Redbook Power User Redbook Basic User Example - If a user belongs to the  Directory  user group, their role should be displayed as: Directory Admin Directory Power User Directory Basic User This applies to  both  the  SDM  and  PMAN User Grid  views. PMAN Admins See the Correct Labels for Users from Different User Groups: Instead of seeing all users under a  single default group label  (e.g., "Discovery Power User" for all users), PMAN Admins should see: John as a Redbook Power User Matt as a Directory Power User Other users based on their user group labels Retain Existing Labeling for Redbook and Directory Admins: Redbook Admins should continue to see only Redbook users with the appropriate  Redbook  role labels. Directory Admins should continue to see only Directory users with the appropriate  Directory  role labels. No change in behavior for these user groups. Current View  - Expected View  - Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Maybe. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks           FYI -   /   /

issues.summary: PMAN: Move Project Section Below Access Section in PMAN > Master Data > Users
issues.description: Business Case: Rearrange the  PMAN > Master Data > Users  page layout by moving the  Project  section below the  Access  section to improve the user experience for PMAN Admins when assigning SDM roles. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? Currently, in  PMAN > Master Data > Users , the  Project  section appears  before  the  Access  section. This ordering is not ideal when a  PMAN Admin  selects an  SDM role , as they should first assign a  User Group  in the  Access  section before determining whether the  Project  section should be displayed. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers using the SDM module (ex: NBCU). What pages should this change impact? PMAN > Master Data > Users. Which users should be impacted by the change? PMAN Admin. How should this feature work? The  Project  section is repositioned  below  the  Access  section on the  PMAN > Master Data > Users  page. issues.summary: SDM: Report Export Restrictions for SDM Users
issues.description: Business Case: Currently, SDM users exporting reports from the Reports section receive all data irrespective of their user group. This user story ensures that report exports for specific report types adhere to the SDM user's assigned user group restrictions while maintaining full data access for PMAN Admins. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? As an SDM user, I want the reports I export to reflect only the data relevant to my user group so that I can access accurate and authorized information. PMAN Admins should continue receiving all data without restrictions. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers using the SDM module (ex: NBCU). What pages should this change impact? SDM > Reports Which users should be impacted by the change? PMAN Admin SDM Admin Example: Redbook Admin (User Group 1 = Redbook) Example: Directory Admin (User Group 2 = Directory) SDM Basic User SDM Power User How should this feature work? Report Type - Quick Contact List: The PDF or Excel export should return results based on the SDM user's assigned user group. PMAN Admins should continue to receive all data as usual. If the SDM Location settings are ON, the Location filter should be applied accordingly. Report Type - Suppliers: The Excel export should return results based on the SDM user's assigned user group. PMAN Admins should continue to receive all data as usual. If the SDM Location settings are ON, the Location filter should be applied accordingly. Report Type - Users: The Excel export should return results based on the SDM user's assigned user group. PMAN Admins should continue to receive all data as usual. Report Type - Supplier Discovery Download: No changes to this report at this time. Further analysis is required to understand the report's purpose before implementing any modifications. Report Type - Exception Form: This option should only be available in the dropdown for SDM users who have the "Enable EF Access" setting ON for their user group. The Excel export should return results based on the SDM user's assigned user group. PMAN Admins should continue to receive all data as usual. Note : Reports  PMAN Admin  can see today - Quick Contact List Suppliers Users Supplier Discovery Download Exception Form Reports  SDM Admin  can see today - Quick Contact List Suppliers Users Supplier Discovery Download Exception Form Reports  SDM Power User  can see today - Quick Contact List Suppliers Exception Form Reports  SDM Basic User  can see today - Quick Contact List Do we need a data fix for existing customers? issues.summary: SDM: UI Enhancement for Supplier Information Display
issues.description: Business Case: The current Supplier Information UI does not dynamically adjust when additional fields, such as Custom fields, are introduced in different sections (e.g., Supplier Details, Business Information, Contract Information, Insurance Information). This results in users having to click on the 'Show Additional' button to view all relevant details. To improve usability and visibility, the system should adapt to fit or introduce scrolling within a particular section, ensuring that important details are readily visible at first glance. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? The Supplier Information UI will dynamically adjust when Custom fields are added to different sections (Supplier Details, Business Information, Contract Information, Insurance Information). Instead of relying on a fixed-length ‘Show Additional’ button, the UI will either expand within reasonable limits or introduce scrolling within the section to ensure important information is visible at first glance. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers using the SDM module (ex: NBCU). What pages should this change impact? SDM > Supplier Search > Supplier Information. Which users should be impacted by the change? PMAN Admin SDM Admin Example: Redbook Admin (User Group 1 = Redbook) Example: Directory Admin (User Group 2 = Directory) SDM Basic User SDM Power User How should this feature work? If Custom fields are added to a section, the UI should automatically expand to accommodate them within reasonable limits. Replace the fixed-length ‘Show Additional’ button with an adaptive expansion mechanism. Implement smooth scrolling within sections to avoid abrupt changes in layout. Maintain a clean and readable format when multiple custom fields are added. Ensure the updated UI works well across different screen sizes and resolutions. Maintain consistency in section heights and scrolling behavior across all sections. Ensure that dynamically adjusting sections do not impact page load time. Provide UI mock ups or suggestions on how we can improve the viewing experience. issues.summary: SDM / PMAN: Update SDM Location Behavior When SDM Locations Toggle is Turned OFF for a User Group setting
issues.description: Business Case: If the  SDM Locations  toggle is turned OFF in the settings for a User Group, users assigned to this User Group should no longer interact with location-related fields or search filters. This ensures that location dependency is removed from the user profile and supplier search functionality while still allowing users to retrieve relevant supplier data based on their User Group association. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? User Modal (PMAN & SDM):  The  Default Location  field should be hidden for users belonging to a User Group where  SDM Locations  is turned OFF. SDM Supplier Search Bar:  The  Location dropdown  should not be displayed. Advanced Search Modal:  The  Search by Location  dropdown should not be displayed. Supplier Search Behavior:  Location should no longer be required as part of the search criteria. Instead, the system should return supplier results based on the User Group assigned to the SDM user. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers using the SDM module (ex: NBCU). What pages should this change impact? SDM > Master Data > Users. PMAN > Master Data > Users. SDM Search. SDM Advanced Search. SDM > Master Data > Suppliers. PMAN > Master Data > Suppliers. Which users should be impacted by the change? PMAN Admin SDM Admin Example: Redbook Admin (User Group 1 = Redbook) Example: Directory Admin (User Group 2 = Directory) SDM Basic User SDM Power User How should this feature work? Default Location Field in User Modal (PMAN & SDM Users) If  SDM Locations  is turned OFF for a User Group: The  Default Location  field should be hidden in the PMAN & SDM User Modal for users assigned to this User Group. If  SDM Locations  is turned ON: The  Default Location  field should be displayed as usual. SDM Locations Field in Supplier Records For User Group Admins: If  SDM Locations  is turned OFF for their assigned User Group, the  SDM Locations  field should be hidden in supplier records. For PMAN Admins: If the supplier is linked to only  one  User Group with  SDM Locations  turned OFF, the  SDM Locations  field should be hidden. If the supplier is linked to  multiple  User Groups where at least one has  SDM Locations  turned ON, the  SDM Locations  field should be visible. SDM Supplier Search Bar Updates If  SDM Locations  is turned OFF for the User Group: The  Location dropdown  should be removed from the search bar. If  SDM Locations  is turned ON: The  Location dropdown  should remain available. Advanced Search Modal Updates If  SDM Locations  is turned OFF for the User Group: The  Search by Location dropdown  should be removed from the Advanced Search modal. If  SDM Locations  is turned ON: The  Search by Location dropdown  should remain available. Supplier Search Criteria Updates If  SDM Locations  is turned OFF for the User Group: The system should not require location as part of the supplier search criteria. Supplier search results should be based solely on suppliers linked to the User Group of the SDM user performing the search. If  SDM Locations  is turned ON: Supplier search should continue functioning as per current behavior with location as a searchable criteria. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Maybe. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  Purchase Team. issues.summary: Vroozi UI: External Workflow: The requester can see the new approval timeline for the external workflow
issues.description: Business Case: As a requester, I want to see the new approval chain timeline when the external workflow is enabled. So I can review the potential approvers and actions they have taken. Acceptance Criteria: The new approval chain timeline for the external workflow should only be visible if the feature flag is ON. (refer to  ). If the feature flag is OFF, the requester should be able to see the existing approval timeline for the external workflow. When enabled, clicking the  Approval Status  button on the PR should open the new Approval timeline for external workflow. Vroozi should fetch the timeline preview and history from the external system. The new approval timeline should look like this: Every node in the timeline should be considered a stair or level in the workflow( e.g. staircase financial workflow ) Every next node on the timeline should be the next stair for the previous node(level). Seeking approval from each node should be compulsory. Once the document is approved from the current node(level), it should proceed to the next node(level). If a single node(level) has multiple approvers, the system should check how many are required to approve to proceed to the next level. The document should move to the next level once all the required approvals are received at the current level. When the PR is in a DRAFT state: The approval timeline overlay should display the following message when no workflow is applicable: The approval timeline should look like this when an external workflow is applicable: The timeline should display all the pending potential approvers. When a timeline node (level) has a single approver: The node should read  Approval Required Display the approver's information, including their first and last name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. When the timeline node(level) has multiple approvers: The node should read  X Approvals Required Multiple Approvers  should appear next to the multiple overlapping circles. Under that, a hyperlink “ Click here for details”  should appear. ( For details. go to the  Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level):  section of the AC ). Once the PR is rejected, and the requester clicks the  Approval Status  button while  working on the rejected PR in the  Rejected  or  Draft  state: The timeline should display all the pending potential approvers after the Rejected node(level). When a timeline node (level) has a single approver: The node should read  Approval Required Display the approver's information, including their first and last name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. When the timeline node(level) has multiple approvers: The node should read  X Approvals Required Multiple Approvers  should appear next to the multiple overlapping circles. Under that, a hyperlink “ Click here for details”  should appear. ( For details. go to the  Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level):  section of the AC ). When the PR is in a post-DRAFT state e.g. Sourcing Review, Submitted(to an external system): The approval timeline overlay should display the following message when no workflow is applicable: The approval timeline should look like this when an external workflow is applicable: The timeline should display the submission, all the pending potential approvers, and all the actions approvers have taken. The submission node(level) should display: The DateTime stamp of the submission  Submitter’s information i.e. First Name and Last Name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. When a timeline node (level) has a single approver and approval is still pending: The node should read  Approval Required Display the approver's information, including their first and last name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. When a timeline node (level) has multiple approvers, and some or all approvals are still pending: The node should read  X Approvals Required Multiple Approvers  should appear next to the multiple overlapping circles. Under that, a hyperlink “ Click here for details”  should appear. ( For details. go to  Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level):  section of the AC ) The actions taken by the approvers should be: Approved Rejected Any other action information comes from the External System( is it even a valid scenario? ) Once the Approval or Rejection is obtained, that approval node(level) should display: When a timeline node (level) has a single approver: In the case of Approval The node should read  Approved. The DateTime stamp of the approval.  Display the approver's information, including their first and last name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. In the case of Rejection The node should read  Rejected. The DateTime stamp of the rejection.  Display the approver's information, including their first and last name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. When a timeline node (level) has multiple approvers: In the case of Approval: The node should read  Approved  once all the required approvals are obtained . The DateTime stamp of the last required approval.  Multiple Approvers  should appear next to the multiple overlapping circles. Under that, a hyperlink “ Click here for details”  should appear. ( For details. go to  Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level):  section of the AC ) In the case of Rejection: The node should read  Rejected  once all the required approvals are obtained . The DateTime stamp of the last required rejection.  Multiple Approvers  should appear next to the multiple overlapping circles. Under that, a hyperlink “ Click here for details”  should appear. ( For details. go to  Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level):  section of the AC ) Once the PR is re-submitted after the rejection, there should be a separate node on the timeline. The re-submission node(level) should display after the rejected node: The DateTime stamp of the re-submission  Submitter’s information i.e. First Name and Last Name, alongside the single circle containing their initials. Child screen for multiple approvers on the same Node(Level): Clicking the “ Click here for details ” hyperlink should open the child screen. When all the required approvals are yet to be obtained The child screen should contain the following information: y  approvals required. A list of potential approvers. When some of the required approvals are obtained: x of y  approvals received. A reverse chronological list of approvers who have taken action on the document. A list of potential approvers who have not yet acted or are no longer required to act When rejection is received: 'x of y  approvals received' or ‘ y  approvals required’ accordingly. y  rejection received. A reverse chronological list of approvers who have taken action on the document. A list of potential approvers who have not yet acted or are no longer required to act When all required approvals are received: y of y  approvals received. A reverse chronological list of approvers who have taken action on the document. A list of potential approvers who have not yet acted or are no longer required to act Workflow type segmentation: Workflow segmentation should be visible on the timeline. By default, the system should display  External Review  for all the external workflow . issues.summary: Vroozi API: External Accounting Validation: The system should allow the external system, to validate accounting info on POCR Submission
issues.description: Business Case: The system should ensure that the accounting information is validated on POCR Submission through an external system. Acceptance Criteria: All the implementation regarding the  External Accounting Validation Configuration Service  has already been implemented in  . A new configurable event should be added to the  External Accounting Validation Configuration Service. This new event should be POCR Submission. To accommodate this new event, a new object “ PO”  should be added to the  External Accounting Validation Configuration Service.  ( Please check the  Internal Accounting Validation Configuration Service  for reference ) For a PO change request, either a brand new POCR can be created or an existing CR can be used.  POCR Submission: When the user hits the POCR  Submit  button, the system should: An In Progress icon should appear on the  Submit  button. ( existing implementation ) Send the request to the external system ( as defined in the Accounting Validation Configuration Service ) The system should submit the POCR only when the accounting validation is completed successfully with no errors. If the accounting validation is completed successfully, and find errors, the system should keep the POCR in its current state.  The  Submit  button label should be updated from Submit to Validation Error(s). ( existing implementation ) Clicking on that should navigate the user to the Accounting Validation Error message visible above the line item grid. ( Please refer to the next section ) The system should keep the document in its current state if the accounting validation call is timed out for any reason. The system should have a red Noty message. ( Please refer to the next section ) The Noty message should be a slider. After 5 seconds, the Noty message should slide away. Accounting Validation Error Message: The system should use the existing error message on the document. issues.summary: R&D on Avalara Tax Upgrade Need
issues.description: Background & Objective The Avalara Tax Connector for our application was developed and tested in a sandbox environment several years ago but was never deployed to client production environment. With client interest growing, we need to ensure our integration meets Avalara’s latest connection guidelines and security requirements. So, the objective of this R&D initiative is to: Assess the current integration to determine its compatibility with Avalara’s latest API and security standards. Identify required upgrades to meet the new connection guidelines and ensure a stable, production-ready integration. Document findings and provide recommendations for implementation. Scope Review the existing Avalara integration. Compare against Avalara’s latest API and integration guidelines. Identify deprecated endpoints, authentication changes, and compliance needs. Test the existing integration using sandbox/production credentials and validate actual features. Document findings and provide recommendations for upgrades. Research & Approach Review Avalara’s latest API documentation to check for changes, deprecations, and security updates. Assess authentication and security to ensure compliance with Avalara’s policies. Test the existing sandbox integration to identify failures, performance issues, and API updates required. Compare sandbox vs. production requirements to ensure a seamless upgrade. Document findings and risks, including code changes, potential challenges, and mitigation strategies. Acceptance Criteria Technical Assessment Report:  Current state analysis, compatibility gaps, and required updates. Upgrade Roadmap:  Action plan with development and testing estimates. Test Plan:  Steps for validating the upgraded integration.

epic.summary: Vroozi Budgets Phase V : Add support for all the Accounting Objects in Budget APIs and add Budget Bulk Upload API

issues.summary: Vroozi API: Update the Budget validation logic to the line item of the PO
issues.description:
Business Case: As an external system user, I want the API to ensure budget validation is performed based on the chosen accounting and organizational object values during PO submission. Acceptance Criteria: Currently, the budget fetching query on the  PO API  modal is: find 
(     (costCenter = enteredValue OR costCenter is Empty)
  AND (GL = enteredValue OR GL is Empty)
  AND (companyCode = enteredValue OR companyCode is Empty)
  AND (purchasingOrganization = enteredValue OR purchasingOrganization is Empty)
  AND (plant = enteredValue OR plant is Empty)
) The above query only considers the objects that are ON for the unitID The above budget query should now handle all the Organization and Accounting objects: find 
(     (companyCode = enteredValue OR companyCode is Empty)
  AND (purchasingOrganization = enteredValue OR purchasingOrganization is Empty)
  AND (plant = enteredValue OR plant is Empty)
  AND (selectedCostObject = enteredValue OR selectedCostObject is Empty)
  AND (GL = enteredValue OR GL is Empty)
  AND (Customer = enteredValue OR Customer is Empty)
  AND (Class = enteredValue OR Class is Empty)
  AND (Project = enteredValue OR Project is Empty)
  AND (locationType = enteredValue OR locationType is Empty)
  AND (location = enteredValue OR location is Empty)
)
 This updated query should only consider the objects that are ON for the unitID This change should impact the  Submit Purchase Order document to Vroozi  API: The system should validate the budget if the specified budget is present in the list of budgets fetched based on the update logic mentioned above. The system should throw the validation error if the specified budget is not in the list of budgets fetched based on the update logic mentioned above. Please note that we will update the budget query soon as it is intricate and very cumbersome to understand.   Technical Details:    Q&A:  Integration Team  (                           ) Question Response Action Status Where is the budget query in PO?

epic.summary: Integration: NBCU Interface Migration - Design and Develop Bulk Load API for Locations

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Bulk upsert Locations
issues.description: Business Case: As an External system user, I want to create/update the Locations in bulk via the API. Acceptance Criteria: Location Bulk Upsert POST API: A New upsert API should be built that allows the user to create/update the Locations in bulk. The type of the API should be POST. The user should be able to provide Locations in bulk. The API should adhere to the API Payload size standards. This API should work asynchronously. The system should validate the Locations' information in the background. The system should let the API user know the API request is accepted. The API should issue a tracking number once the user posts the API. Location Bulk Upsert Status GET API: Another API should be built that allows the user to get the status of the Location Bulk Upsert POST API by providing the tracking number. The type of the API should be GET. If the API does not return the status of the Location Bulk Upsert POST API does not return the status, the system should return the error with details. This Location Bulk Upsert Status GET API should return the following statuses of the Location Bulk Upsert POST API: If all the Locations are created/updated successfully, the header level response status should be COMPLETED. Each Object status should be SUCCESS. If some or all Locations are still being created or updated, the header level status should be IN PROGRESS. Each Object status should be SUCCESS/IN PROGRESS/ERROR accordingly. If all of the Locations are processed and some or all of them have validation errors, the status should be COMPLETED WITH ERRORS. Each Object status should be SUCCESS/ERROR accordingly. If all the Locations are processing failed due to some technical error (e.g. time out) that can be fixed by retrying, the status should be FAILURE. Each Object status should be FAILED If some of the Locations are processing failed due to some technical error (e.g. time out) that can be fixed by retrying and some are processed successfully without any error, the status should be COMPLETED WITH FAILURE. Each Object status should be SUCCESS/FAILED accordingly. This Location Bulk Upsert Status GET API should return the count of: Total items Items successfully uploaded Items failed(due to failure or validation error) The Location Bulk Upsert Status GET API should return the state of each Location in the API payload: The status should be In Progress if the Location is still in Progress. The status should be Success if the Location is created successfully. The status should be Error if the Location is not created due to: Validation Error Duplication Failure (time out etc) The response should also contain the details of each error type according to the set pattern of showcasing the error details. Documentation: There should be two new entries in the API Documentation in the  Location  sub-menu of the  Master Data  menu Those two entries should be for the following APIs: Location Bulk Upsert POST API ( please use the naming convention as per standards ) The API summary( appears next to the API endpoint ) should be ‘ Create or Update the Locations   in bulk asynchronously’ . The details should be ' Create or Update the Locations in bulk asynchronously '. Location Bulk Upsert Status GET API ( please use the naming convention as per standards ) The API summary( appears next to the API endpoint ) should be ‘ Get progress status of the bulk upsert Location by Tracking ID ’. The details should be ' Get progress status of the bulk upsert Location by Tracking ID '. Technical Details:    Q&A:  Integration Team  (                           ) Question Response Action
